item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 19th October
item.description:
Traffic lights Timings are incorrect Phot taken at 17:15. No traffic queuing on the other 3 junctions. It appears the sensors to measure traffic flow are not working

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 19th October
item.description:
The change in kerb at junction now makes the turning very sharp and narrow and it is not possible for cars to enter road without crossing onto the wrong side of road. Additional road narrowing measures also make use of this road difficult. A less sharp as angle to the corner kerbs at the junction would be safer for cars to enter and emerge.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Large fur tree on the verge is blacking visibility O/S number 26, 19th October
item.description:
A Tree blocking visibility on road/junction problem has been found by Gloucestershire County Council - The tree is about 10/12 feet wide at the base, this is encroaching on the c/way and is blocking visibility and is a risk to people using the f/way are at risk from this tree.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Three Sisters Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 19th October
item.description:
series of trees in the back garden, overgrown ans over lapping the back garden, and coming into the back garden, worried about them as one of them has a trunk which has now split in to and hanging over the garden...customer asked for call and site visit please
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 19th October
item.description:
Non-Illuminated bollards and signs SignSustained other damage Sign Wooden posts holding up the "Cherry Avenue" road sign at junction of Cherry Avenue and Willow Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham have eventually rotted through and sign has collapsed and needs replacement. Attached are images of the sign and its location.

item.title: Fly Tip - Top of Aggs Hill on Right Hand Side, 19th October
item.description:
The fly tip is located on the Right Hand Side going towards the Burnt Oak Crossroads and about 20 yards from the Cotswold Way Gate. It is under the trees near the wall and is difficult to see due to it being both dark material and dark from the trees. The tip is a wall cabinet together with other rubbish. Please can it be collected up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bag of Rubbish - Hit by Vehicles - now over road, 19th October
item.description:
A flytipped bag of rubbish has been hit by multple vehicles and has been strewn along both sides of Mill Lane at the location. Please can the litter created be cleaned up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
